channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Vehicle hit bollard and pulled up tarmac, 17th December
item.description:
A vehicle appears to have collided with a bollard on the pavement on Honor Oak Rise, which has pulled up a large section of paving and the bollard is standing at 45 degrees. Hazardous as someone could trip on it, plus it doesn't look great!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Rise, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking pavement, 17th December
item.description:
There are lime bikes blocking pavement for pedestrians outside Portman Square Garden opposite to 15 Portman Square. The bikes need to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Portman Square, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves, 17th December
item.description:
The south side pavement of Bromley Road pretty much from Oakwood Avenue upwards towards Ashmere Avenue needs leaf removal please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping Selborne Road, 17th December
item.description:
Flytipping mattress Selborne Road. For collection please. Thank you!

item.title: Dumped Car, 17th December
item.description:
No MOT since 2nd September 2025. The car has been here for over a year. The council has a duty to remove abandoned cars. This person has over nine cars left in St Margaret's Grove and the surrounding areas. Please remove them. Please, this has been going on for years.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Margarets Grove, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big bulk furniture and appliances blocking our door, 17th December
item.description:
Lots of furnitures like sofa, chairs, mattress, boxes, wooden pallets and big households appliances like fridges has been dumbed outside of my flat and blocking the way for months now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hare Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HMO property dumping bed frame outside, 17th December
item.description:
Old bed frame dumped outside HMO 28 Kirkham street. Making the area look uncared for. We have to pay yo get our rubbish collected. Shouldn't owners of HMOs get charged for the rubbish dumped by their tenants.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kirkham Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter near the bus stop and just past the bus stop near a tree., 17th December
item.description:
Two lots of litter and a coat. One lot is just before the bus stop, the coat behind a post and more litter by a tree which is past the bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Okehampton Crescent, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All of Charteris Road, 17th December
item.description:

item.title: Bromley Common - Tatty with litter, 17th December
item.description:
Report relates to full length of Bromley Common, from junction with Oakley Road to junction with Johnson Road (north of Crown Lane Spur roundabout). Both sides of road: pavements, grass verges, hedge and fence lines, trees and undergrowth on west side of road (as driving along Bromley Common towards Bromley), around bus stops. A lot of the litter within the roadside undergrowth/trees etc will require removing manually. It would be very much appreciated if this main road could be walked and cleaned properly the first time of asking, it’s looking a bit tatty currently. Thanks,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A21, Bromley Common, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
